member.summary: Display EULA if user clicks on link label. Note that this is a PDF file and an error will occur if Adobe Reader is not installed on the user's computer.

member.summary: Invoke an email message for support. If no email application is installed or running on the user's computer, then an error message will be displayed.

member.name: M:VirtualSoftware.AboutDialog.GetFrameworkShortVersion
member.summary: Framework short version, ie: 2.0
member.returns: Returns a string with the version number, if there is an error an empty string is returned.

member.name: M:VirtualSoftware.AboutDialog.GetFrameworkServicePack
member.summary: A special section of the registry has to be querried to find out the service pack of the .NET Framework. A different location was used for 1.0 and 1.1, but since this application only runs on version 2.0, we won't worry about that.
member.returns: A string containing the version number, for example: "2.0"

member.name: M:VirtualSoftware.AboutDialog.ReturnHighestFrameworkVersion
member.summary: Queries the Registry and returns the highest .NET Framework version found or 0 if none is found.
member.returns: A string indicating the major and minor version of the .NET Framework and service pack (if any).
member.remarks: This code is confirmed for versions 2.0, 3.0, 3.5 and 4.0.

member.name: M:VirtualSoftware.AboutDialog.GetUserCustomerOrganization
member.summary: Query registry for information.

member.name: M:VirtualSoftware.AboutDialog.GetUserCustomerName
member.summary: Query registry for information.

member.name: M:VirtualSoftware.AboutDialog.GetOSUptime
member.summary:
This method gets the system up time by Imports the system clock. Most of this code is used to format the output of the system timer (in milliseconds) to a more useful format: DD:HH:MM:SS.
Note since the system timer rolls over every 47 days, this method will return an incorrect value on a system that has been up for more than 47 days.
This method is called by the timer.
member.returns: A formatted string containing the system up time in the format DD:HH:MM:SS

member.name: M:VirtualSoftware.AboutDialog.TimerTickCount_Tick(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This timer is used to update the display of system up time and the date and time displayed in the StatusStrip at the bottom of the form.

member.name: M:VirtualSoftware.AboutDialog.ButtonOK_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This button will close the form if the form was called with ShowDialog

member.name: M:VirtualSoftware.AboutDialog.ButtonSysInfo_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This button open Microsoft System Information.

member.name: T:VirtualSoftware.AboutDialog
member.summary:
Generic About Box for use with my projects. Provides basic system information as well as system up time and the current date and time. The header is a panel which my contain a background image or color. A picture box (48x48 pixels) can display a custom image.
There are two buttons on the form, "Microsoft System Information," which starts msinfo32.exe and "OK," which dismisses the form. Typing Escape on the keyboard will also dismiss the form.
There are two link labels. The first opens a file called "EULA.pdf" Imports the Adobe Reader that is installed on the computer. The "EULA.pdf" file must reside in the application folder. The other link label initiates an email to me. This is normally not visible for non-commercial applications. the application folder.
member.remarks: The application will produce an error dialog if msinfo32.exe or EULA.pdf is not found.
